projectData.name: YesChef
projectData.desc: Create your team's schedule and share it easily with YesChef!
tellMeMore: Began development on May 6th (2024), and it was developed for 1 month to be considered an MVP.
Utilizes the same stack as PollR.
Created to fascilitate scheduling as I was once looking forward to becomming a General Manager at a pizza shop.

While I never got the chance to use it in my job, many other General Managers in the company adopted it and still use it regularly. This is because the scheduling funtionality provided to them refused to work, and mine met their needs consistently.
whatILearned: Custom PDF Creation with Puppeteer.
Sending Emails with the NodeMailer library.
Life Lesson: Account for edge cases.

In order add a new employee to your database, you needed their email. In order to send that employee their schedule, you also needed their email. Heck, just to get hired they'd need to provide an email! The truth is, even our bosses lose track of stuff like that, so I learned to account for what to do in case that happens.

projectData.name: PollR
projectData.desc: Letting you ask and answer the questions on everybody's minds.
tellMeMore: This is our 3rd Capstone Project of Bootcamp, and it was developed for 2 weeks until it was considered an MVP.
Uses JSON Web Tokens(JWT) to manage authentication.
Utilizes the same stack as YesChef.
whatILearned: Life Lesson: Never underestimate your teammates.

The PollR logo was created by someone on our team that we were reluctant to recruit on account of past laziness. Turns out, he knew a thing or two about creating custom SVG graphics, and the result was amazing.

projectData.name: Just_Another_Text_Editor
projectData.desc: A Progressive Web App to write code snippets dependably.
tellMeMore: This is my Week 19 Project for Bootcamp, and it was developed for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
Scores very highly on Google Lighthouse Report.
Uses a manifest.json file to cache icons store code, becoming installable and usable even offline.
whatILearned: Precaching assets using web service workers.
Storing data in IndexedDB, and using localStorage as a fallback.
Life Lesson: Sometimes even the pointless apps turn out to be worth it.

Working with WebPack and all of its config files are not fun when compared to something that works right out of the box, like Vite. That being said, creating a PWA is a great experience that any developer should try. The fact that my website can also live on my desktop or phone as a native-like app is awesome.

projectData.name: Brew-Finder
projectData.desc: Find pubs, bars, and breweries nearby or in a town near you!
tellMeMore: This is our 1st Capstone Project of Bootcamp, and it was developed for 2 weeks until it was considered an MVP.
Open-Brewery API provides data on nearby spots.
The Geo.js library accurately gets the user's location.
The Clearbit Logo API retrieves high-quality company logos and icons.
whatILearned: Life Lesson: Be a leader, but let others have a turn, too.

Taking all of the creative leadership gets hard. You sift through potential background images and font styles and it gets exhausting, and I'm glad that I had a few extra hands to cover the visual aspect of this project.

projectData.name: Book_Search_Engine
projectData.desc: Find your next reading adventure with Google's Books API.
tellMeMore: This is my Week 21 Project for Bootcamp, and it was developed for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
Uses JSON Web Tokens(JWT) to manage authentication.
My first MERN Stack application!
whatILearned: Migrating a full stack app from a RESTful API to a GraphQL API.

projectData.name: Social_Network_API
projectData.desc: An API built to handle any social media site's needs: posts, comments, and reactions.
tellMeMore: This is my Week 18 Project for Bootcamp, and it was developed for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
whatILearned: Creating virtual fields to perform and display agregate functions.
Using the Mongoose ODM to interop with MongoDB.

projectData.name: jbassard97nodecolors
projectData.desc: An NPM module to easily colorize terminal output.
tellMeMore: My first NPM Module!
Contains 100% JavaScript.
Carries zero dependencies.
whatILearned: Life Lesson: It's ok if your little NPM package doesn't turn heads.
This package isn't particularly popular in the community, but it certainly plays a role spicing up many of my projects.

projectData.name: ButtonSynth
projectData.desc: A pocket instrument to make music anywhere.
tellMeMore: Began development on December 13th (2023), and it was developed for 3 months until it was considered an MVP.
The project was picked back up in early June, and functionality for playing chords was implemented.
whatILearned: Creating custom event listeners to handle multiple touch inputs at once.
Playing made-from-scratch audio using the Web Audio API.
Life Lesson: Make something that makes you happy.

projectData.name: DokePex
projectData.desc: 1-to-1 representation of a device from a beloved franchise
tellMeMore: My first project completed after Bootcamp.
Uses the Pokemon API for data, icons, and audio files.
Rich audio elements for every monster's cries.
(Press A for an easter egg!)
whatILearned: Creating a frontend app with Vue, in a setting where I'd typically reach for React.
Life Lesson: Try everything at least once, but stick to your favorites.

projectData.name: Bookshelf
projectData.desc: A place for book lovers to create and save book collections. Make an account!
tellMeMore: This is our 2nd Capstone Project of Bootcamp, and it was developed for 2 weeks until it was considered an MVP.
Coded using the MVC (Model, View, Controller) paradigm.
Uses the OpenLibrary API for data and images for each book.
whatILearned: Chaining API calls without sacrificing performance.
Deploying a full-stack app on Heroku, utilizing the JawsDB service.
Life Lesson: If something stops being worth paying for, stop paying for it.

Our Bootcamp program provided us with enough Heroku credits to freely deploy on the site for the duration of the course. However, these credits eventually ran out, and I started seeing little $5 charges each month. Nipping that in the bud, I've learned the value of finding free options.

projectData.name: SVG_Logo_Maker
projectData.desc: Choose from 3 different shapes, the entire rainbow of colors, and add up to 3 letters inside!
tellMeMore: This is my Week 10 Project for Bootcamp, and it was developed for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
Conversing with the user through the Inquirer package.
whatILearned: Object Oriented Programming in JavaScript.
Using the fs module for dynamic file creation.

projectData.name: autoCommit
projectData.desc: A sneaky GitHub Actions script to ensure a constant streak of daily commits.
tellMeMore: Began development on June 27th (2024), and it was developed for 3.5 months until it was considered an MVP.

Initially worked locally using Window's Task Scheduler to run the script. This was only successful if my laptop was open specifically when it was scheduled to work, so I utilized a cron job within Github Actions to have it fire as often as I'd like.
whatILearned: Life Lesson: Sometimes it's fun to do bad things.

Is it wrong to have a project that pads your commit history like this? Heck no. Especially not when I learn something valuable from it, like how to use an integral part of GitHub's robust line of pipelines.

projectData.name: Professional_README_Generator
projectData.desc: Walks the user through a Q&A to craft a professional, high-quality README.md
tellMeMore: This is my Week 9 Project for Bootcamp, and it was developed for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
Most of my README's are made through this CLI app.
Similar stack and methods used in a private project used to aid in job-applying: Cover_Letter_Generator.
whatILearned: Gained a greater familiarity with Markdown language.
Collecting user inputs with the Inquirer package.

projectData.name: Next_Hang_Man
projectData.desc: An awesome game to kill time, with a modern twist on the classic Hangman.
tellMeMore: Created to solve 2 problems: I wanted to learn Next.js, and I wanted to cure boredom.
Can be played either by using the on-screen keyboard component or a physical keyboard
Uses the Random Word Generator API, which allows you to choose the length of returned words.
Heavily inspired by Wordle.
whatILearned: The Next.js and many of it's features, including the file-based routing system (which I love), server components, and framework specific tools.

projectData.name: Employee_Tracker
projectData.desc: A Content Management System for everyone on payroll
tellMeMore: This is my Week 12 Project for Bootcamp, and it was developed for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
whatILearned: Writing complex SQL queries and performing CRUD operations on database tables.

projectData.name: TellMeAbout
projectData.desc: Plug in any variable or value and automatically infer as much information about it as possible.
tellMeMore: Created to knock the rust off of my JavaScript foundations and remind myself of all the methods used for various data types.
whatILearned: Life Lesson: No one cares about NPM packages with minimal utility.
It's not bad to create a library that focuses on one small thing, but don't expect too much attention for it.

projectData.name: Work_Day_Scheduler
projectData.desc: A simple calendar app for scheduling your work day.
tellMeMore: This is my Week 5 Project for Bootcamp, and it was developed for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
Utilizes Day.js (Date and Time Library) for real-time updates.
Caches your appointments in localStorage.
whatILearned: JQuery, CDN, Bootstrap
Life Lesson: Take pride in what you make.

The starter code for this project had very minimal styling. Implementing various themes for each quarter of the workday was beyond the scope of the assignment, but I'm glad to at least make it look good and make it mine.

projectData.name: 5_Day_Weather
projectData.desc: See the current weather and five-day forecast for your area, or the town next to yours!
tellMeMore: This is my Week 6 Project for Bootcamp, and it was developed for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
whatILearned: Third-Party APIs, Open-Weather API, Fetch, Promises
Life Lesson: Sometimes your app works on desktop browser but not on a mobile one, and that's okay if the app isn't a big deal.

projectData.name: PythonTerminalQuest
projectData.desc: A fully fledged RPG based entirely in your command line of choice, complete with sounds and keyboard events.
tellMeMore: Began development on September 8th (2024), and it is still in progress.
This project is projected be completed around June of 2025.
Utilizes PyGame for audio control.
Utilizes the Keyboard library for typing events.
whatILearned: Using PIP to install and manage dependencies.
Life Lesson: Don't bite off more than you can chew.

Everyone dreams of making a video game. That might sound silly, but it's an awesome goal to accomplish as a programmer. I certainly didn't realize how much thought goes into the story-telling aspect of one, and that is this project's only hangup.

projectData.name: Code-Corner
projectData.desc: A blog for letting budding developers learn and contribute to the community. Make an account!
tellMeMore: This is my Week 14 Project for Bootcamp, and it was developed for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
Coded using the MVC (Model, View, Controller) paradigm.
whatILearned: How to create a Blog/Social Media Site completely from scratch.
How to connect to an external MySQL database and interop with it using Sequelize ORM

projectData.name: Note_Taker
projectData.desc: Quickly jot notes down with this convenient web app.
tellMeMore: This is my Week 11 Project for Bootcamp, and it was developed for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
whatILearned: Creating servers with the Express.js web framework.

projectData.name: Code_Quiz
projectData.desc: A 5 question quiz on the essentials of JavaScript, caches your highscore in localStorage!
tellMeMore: This is my Week 4 Project for Bootcamp, and it was developed for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
whatILearned: Dynamically creating an placing elements through DOM Manipulation in vanilla JavaScript.
Storing data in the browser using the localStorage functions setItem() and getItem().

projectData.name: Regex_Simplified
projectData.desc: A GitHub Gist that helps demystify Regex Patterns in JavaScript.
tellMeMore: This is my Week 17 Project for Bootcamp, written for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
whatILearned: How to create a Regex Pattern from scratch
Creating written articles and deploying them as GitHub Gists.

projectData.name: Portfolio_v1
projectData.desc: The 1st itteration of my portfolio page, created in my 2nd week of Bootcamp.
tellMeMore: This is my Week 2 Project for Bootcamp, and it was developed for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
whatILearned: CSS Resets, Selectors, Pseudo-Classes, Pseudo-Elements, and Variables

projectData.name: Portfolio_v2
projectData.desc: The 2nd itteration of my portfolio page, created in the 20th week of Bootcamp.
tellMeMore: This is my Week 20 Project for Bootcamp, and it was developed for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
whatILearned: Utilizes React Router for page navigation.
Utilizes Typescript for full type safety.

projectData.name: Password_Generator
projectData.desc: Follow the browser's prompts to create a custom password that meets a number of your criteria.
tellMeMore: This is my Week 3 Project for Bootcamp, and it was developed for 1 week until it was considered an MVP.
whatILearned: <span style='color:lightblue'>Arrays, Functions, Objects, and the Window object<span style='color:lightblue'>.
